archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Paneer Tikka Masala Feast with Saffron Cashew Pulao and Cucumber-Mint Raita
description: A family feast of oven-roasted paneer tikka folded into a rich masala, served with fragrant saffron cashew pulao and cooling cucumber-mint raita. Medium heat and from-scratch layers for a weekend showstopper.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 240°C (465°F). Line a baking tray with foil and lightly oil it.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Warm 2 tablespoons milk and crumble saffron into it; set aside to bloom.
Cut paneer into 2–3 cm cubes. Cut bell peppers into 3 cm chunks. Slice 2 onions; finely chop 1 onion.
Crush or finely chop 4 cloves garlic.
Finely chop mint and coriander. Peel and grate cucumber; squeeze out excess liquid.
Measure whole spices for rice: 2 bay leaves, 4 cardamom, 1 small piece cinnamon, 4 cloves.
Set out all spices and ingredients for quick access.
cook_steps: Marinate paneer: In a bowl, mix yoghurt (1/2 cup), tikka paste (2 tablespoons), tikka spice blend (1 tablespoon), lemon juice (1 tablespoon), salt (1 teaspoon), and oil (1 tablespoon). Add paneer and bell peppers; toss to coat and rest 15 minutes.
Roast paneer: Spread marinated paneer and peppers on the tray. Roast 12–15 minutes until lightly charred at edges. Set aside.
Start pulao: Heat ghee (2 tablespoons) in a pot over medium heat. Add bay leaves, cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves; sizzle 30 seconds. Add drained rice; stir 1 minute to coat.
Add peas (1 cup), salt (1 teaspoon), saffron milk, and water (2 3/4 cups). Bring to a simmer, cover, reduce to low, and cook 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest 10 minutes off heat.
Toast cashews: In a small pan, toast cashews (1/2 cup) in 1 teaspoon ghee or oil over medium heat until golden; reserve.
Make masala: Heat oil (2 tablespoons) in a wide pan over medium. Add cumin seeds (1 teaspoon). Add sliced onions; cook 8–10 minutes until deep golden. Add garlic; stir 30 seconds.

Spice and simmer: Add garam masala (2 teaspoons), turmeric powder (1/2 teaspoon), paprika (1 teaspoon), and cayenne pepper (1/4–1/2 teaspoon). Stir 30 seconds. Add crushed tomatoes (1 1/2 cups) and tomato paste (1 tablespoon). Season with salt (to taste) and simmer 8–10 minutes, stirring.
Finish the sauce: Stir in cream (1/2 cup). Add roasted paneer and peppers; simmer 3–5 minutes to coat. Add chopped coriander (2 tablespoons).
Finish pulao: Fluff rice with a fork and fold in toasted cashews.
Make raita: In a bowl, combine yoghurt (1 cup), grated cucumber, chopped mint (2 tablespoons), lemon juice (1 teaspoon), black pepper (to taste), and salt (to taste).
Plate: Serve paneer tikka masala with saffron cashew pulao, raita on the side, and optional mango pickle for a spicy kick.

Finely chop mint and coriander. Peel and grate cucumber; squeeze out excess liquid.
Measure whole spices for rice: 2 bay leaves, 4 cardamom, 1 small piece cinnamon, 4 cloves.
Set out all spices and ingredients for quick access.

Marinate paneer: In a bowl, mix yoghurt (1/2 cup), tikka paste (2 tablespoons), tikka spice blend (1 tablespoon), lemon juice (1 tablespoon), salt (1 teaspoon), and oil (1 tablespoon). Add paneer and bell peppers; toss to coat and rest 15 minutes.

Finish pulao: Fluff rice with a fork and fold in toasted cashews.
Make raita: In a bowl, combine yoghurt (1 cup), grated cucumber, chopped mint (2 tablespoons), lemon juice (1 teaspoon), black pepper (to taste), and salt (to taste).

ingredients.preparation: divided (1/2 cup for marinade; 1 cup for raita)

final_ingredients.preparation: divided (1/2 cup for marinade; 1 cup for raita)
